name: St. Charles Borromeo
summary: Charles Borromeo was an Italian cardinal and Archbishop of Milan. He was a leading figure in the Counter-Reformation and was instrumental in implementing the reforms of the Council of Trent. He established seminaries, reformed the clergy, and worked tirelessly for the poor and sick. During a plague in Milan, he personally cared for the victims. He is the patron saint of bishops, catechists, and seminarians.
keyQuotes: Be sure that you first preach by the way you live.
